column4: I did have java working on here, but in synaptic, I cannot find which package javac, java, etc are in
use the search option in synaptic, search for java
what version of ubuntu are you using?
provided you have the proper repos enabled, you should be able to get java via "sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts" which will also add the firefox plugin
I'm getting this error: com.sun.tools.javac.Main is not on the classpath
and no java6 plugin, that's why I installed 1.4
I have no idea about that one
got to easylinux.info, the feisty section, check your repo list against the one they have, and then try again
you have multiverse and univers, canonical fre and non-free and medibuntu free and non-free in your repo list?
looks like you have everything, you could try going to suns java site and installing the official from them, but first uninstall any java you already have installed via apt
beyond that I do not know what to tell you, sorry I could not be more help than that
